text: “A machine in a shop or other business that records sales and into which money received is put.”
“The amount of money in a bank account.”
“A person whose job is to receive and pay out money in a shop, bank, restaurant.”
“A piece of paper with a price that is attached to a product, or the amount that something costs.”
“An act of exchanging something for money.”
“A small plastic card that can be used as a method of payment, for which you’re billed afterwards.”
“A small plastic card that can be used as a method of payment (instant).”
“A small case for carrying money, credit cards, and small personal documents.”
“A card that can be exchanged in a shop or on a website for goods or services of the value that is printed on it.”
“An itemized list or a statement of particulars (such as a list of materials) given to the potential customer.”
“Writing acknowledging the receiving of goods or money.”
“An itemized list or a statement of particulars (such as a list of materials) generated by the seller.”
